function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of standardization in metagenomics protocols","Impact":"Inaccurate identification of pathogens and resistance genes, leading to ineffective surveillance","Mitigation":"Standardize protocols for metagenomics to ensure consistent and reliable results","Technologies":"Quality control measures for sequencing, data analysis algorithms","People":"Researchers, scientists, and professionals working in pathogen and resistance surveillance","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Inadequate utilization of urine proteomics for disease biomarkers","Impact":"Missed opportunity to identify early indicators of disease and health biomarkers, leading to delayed diagnosis and intervention","Mitigation":"Promote research and development in urine proteomics, and increase awareness of its potential in disease diagnosis and surveillance","Technologies":"Advanced protein analysis techniques, data mining and bioinformatics tools","People":"Medical researchers, clinicians, and public health professionals","Owner":"Medical research institutions, healthcare organizations, and government health agencies"},{"Description":"Limited integration of urinary biomarkers in wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE)","Impact":"Reduced capability to monitor population health and disease trends through wastewater surveillance, overlooking key indicators of public health threats","Mitigation":"Explore and validate the use of urinary biomarkers in WBE, and advocate for their inclusion in surveillance programs","Technologies":"Integration of urinary biomarker analysis with existing WBE technologies and data collection methods","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, and wastewater management professionals","Owner":"Public health agencies, environmental protection agencies, and wastewater treatment facilities"}]}
